member.name: T:WinMonitorAA.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:WinMonitorAA.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:WinMonitorAA.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:WinMonitorAA.My.Resources.Resources.descarga
member.summary: Looks up a localized resource of type System.Drawing.Icon similar to (Icon).

member.name: T:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey
member.summary: Class to perform system-wide hotkey operations.

member.name: T:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.NativeMethods
member.summary: Native API Methods.

member.name: M:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.NativeMethods.RegisterHotKey(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Defines a system-wide hotkey.
member.param: The identifier of the hotkey. If the hWnd parameter is NULL, then the hotkey is associated with the current thread rather than with a particular window. If a hotkey already exists with the same hWnd and id parameters.

The keys that must be pressed in combination with the key specified by the uVirtKey parameter in order to generate the WM_HOTKEY message. The fsModifiers parameter can be a combination of the following values.
The virtual-key code of the hotkey.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds, otherwise false

member.name: M:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.NativeMethods.UnregisterHotKey(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Unregisters a hotkey previously registered.
member.param: The identifier of the hotkey to be unregistered.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds, otherwise false

member.name: P:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.Key
member.summary: Indicates the key assigned to the hotkey.

member.name: P:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.Modifier
member.summary: Indicates the Key-Modifier assigned to the hotkey.

member.name: P:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.ID
member.summary: Indicates the unique identifier assigned to the hotkey.

member.name: P:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.Tag
member.summary: Indicates user-defined data associated with this object.

member.name: P:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.Count
member.summary: Indicates how many times was pressed the hotkey.

member.name: T:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.KeyModifier
member.summary: Key-modifiers to assign to a hotkey.

member.name: F:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.KeyModifier.None
member.summary: Any modifier.

member.name: F:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.KeyModifier.Alt
member.summary: The Alt key.

member.name: F:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.KeyModifier.Ctrl
member.summary: The Control key.

member.name: F:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.KeyModifier.Shift
member.summary: The Shift key.

member.name: F:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.KeyModifier.Win
member.summary: The Windows key.

member.name: T:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.KnownMessages
member.summary: Known Windows Message Identifiers.

member.name: F:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.KnownMessages.WM_HOTKEY
member.summary:
Posted when the user presses a hot key registered by the RegisterHotKey function. The message is placed at the top of the message queue associated with the thread that registered the hot key.
The identifier of the hot key that generated the message. If the message was generated by a system-defined hot key.
The low-order word specifies the keys that were to be pressed in combination with the key specified by the high-order word to generate the WM_HOTKEY message.

member.name: E:WinMonitorAA.GlobalHotkey.Press
member.summary: Event that is raised when a hotkey is pressed.

member.summary: Event arguments for the Press event.

member.summary: Indicates the unique identifier assigned to the hotkey.

member.summary: Indicates how many times was pressed the hotkey.

member.summary: Registers this hotkey on the system.

member.summary: Unregisters this hotkey from the system. After calling this method the hotkey turns unavaliable.
member.returns: true if unregistration succeeds, false otherwise.
